intro: Hemigraphis mindorensis, commonly known as Mindanao nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, velvety foliage with varying shades of red, purple, and green. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences, often in shades of pink or white. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and indoor spaces.
